definition: to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: A business that contracts to work with another business.
sentences.chinese: 签订合同与另一公司合作的公司。

sentences.english: The secret of a good old age is simply an honorable pact with solitude.
sentences.chinese: 安度晚年的秘诀，就是和孤独签订体面的协议。

sentences.english: Developer will sign an agreement with each participant for the fee payment.
sentences.chinese: 承办方将与各投标单位签订协议，以支付相应费用。

sentences.english: The terms under which China Sonangol buys oil from Angola have never been made public.
sentences.chinese: 中国和安中石油签订的石油采购条款从未被曝光。

sentences.english: He muffed a good opportunity for a big contract.
sentences.chinese: 他把签订一项大合同的好机会错过了。

sentences.english: A: All we have to do is sign the contract .
sentences.chinese: 剩下的只要签订个契约就行了。

sentences.english: This term will also be written in the tri-party agreement which will be signed later as required.
sentences.chinese: 该条款也将在随后要求签订的三方协议中予以约定。

sentences.english: Kunming airport pick the contract after the signing of travel, freedom of movement.
sentences.chinese: 昆明机场接机后签订旅游合同，自由活动。

sentences.english: We've signed an agreement and we can't back out of it now.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经签订了协议，现在可不能打退堂鼓。

sentences.english: It was beyond his power to sign such a contract.
How will you react if he asks you to sign a pre-nup ?
sentences.chinese: 如果他要你签订婚前合约，你会怎样反应呢？

sentences.english: He landed with a guard of 500 men to sign the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 他偕同500人的警卫队一起登陆，签订条约。

sentences.english: By the spring of1972, the Sino-American Shanghai Communique had been signed.
sentences.chinese: 到了1972年春天，签订了中美上海公报。

sentences.english: The two companies made a subcontract just now.
sentences.chinese: 那两个公司刚签订了一个转包合同。

sentences.english: Service Contract must be with qualified shier.
sentences.chinese: 服务合同必须与合格的托运人签订。

sentences.english: The countries in the region sign a non-aggression pact.
sentences.chinese: 在该地区的国家签订了一个互不侵犯的条约。

definition: to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)

to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
labor contract/contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions
to sign a contract or agreement
to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
